Tokyo's Nikkei added 7.6%, its best week in a month.Oil futures fell more than $2 to $52.43 a barrel, holding near the center of its recent $49 to $55 range.10:15 a.m. Update: Dow Hangs Tough While Peers Lose GroundBY VINCENT MAOStocks opened lower, turned narrowly mixed, then turned lower again early Friday.The Nasdaq was down 1.1%, the NYSE composite 0.8% and the S&P 500 0.4%. The Dow was mostly unchanged.Volume was tracking sharply lower on the Nasdaq and a bit lower on the NYSE.Financials were mostly higher. Citigroup (C) gapped up and rose 12% in fast trade. The bank has advanced four straight sessions after receiving a government bailout Monday.Bank of America (BAC) and JPMorgan Chase (JPM) each rose 2%.On the downside, ArcelorMittal (MT) shed 6% after announcing a round of job cuts. The world's largest steel maker will slash 9,000 jobs in response to the global economic slowdown.Panasonic (PC) gapped down and dived nearly 20% after cutting its profit outlook. Hurt by a strong yen and weak sales, the electronics maker pegged full-year income at $316 million, down sharply from a prior forecast of $3.3 billion.9:15 a.m. Update: Stocks Poised For Soft Start In Short SessionBY VINCENT MAOStock futures signaled a weaker open as equities look to pull back from their recent gains in an abbreviated session.Nasdaq futures dropped 15 points vs. fair value, S&P 500 future shed 7 points and Dow futures gave up 27 points.Overseas markets were mostly mixed. Hong Kong's Hang Seng and Japan's Nikkei gained 2.5% and 1.7%, respectively. In India, where stock markets reopened following this week's terrorist attacks in Mumbai, the Sensex rose 0.7%. Meanwhile, Germany's DAX lost 1.4% and London's FTSE slipped a fraction.U.S. markets will close at 1 p.m. EST. Trading volume is expected to be light.Retailers will be in focus on this Black Friday. Hit by a waning economy, same-store sales tumbled a record 2.8% in October.Nordstrom (JWN) fell 2% in the pre-market. Wal-Mart (WMT) slipped a fraction and Best Buy (BBY) rose a fraction.Chesapeake Energy (CHK) dived 14% on news that it filed to sell up to $1.8 billion in common shares.Nokia  (NOK) said it will stop selling most of its cell phones in Japan, though it will continue selling its luxury Vertu brand there.Crude oil slipped 60 cents to $53.84 a barrel.
5:15 p.m. Update: Stocks plummeted Thursday, as regulators around the globe struggled to control damage in financial markets.
The NYSE composite spiraled 7.9% lower, bringing its two-week loss through Thursday to 26%. The S&P 500 tore off a 7.6% loss, the Dow 7.3%. The Nasdaq composite kicked and clawed but lost 5.5%.

Preliminary data showed volume down 4% on the NYSE and 16% lower on the Nasdaq. Decliners led advancing issues by 10-to-1 on the NYSE and by 5-to-1 on the Nasdaq. Only one of the 197 industry groups tracked by IBD gained ground: Farm equipment makers rose 1.6%. The consumer and commercial loans group clocked the worst loss of the day, down 21%.
Energy and financial sectors were the NYSE's biggest losers, and financial issues weighed heavily among the S&P 500's worst losses.

Intuitive Surgical (ISRG) exerted a large share of the Nasdaq 100's downward pull. Exxon Mobil (XOM) and Chevron (CVX) were the Dow's leading tumblers, followed close behind by American Express (AXP), Bank of America (BAC) and Citigroup (C).
Oil prices fell below $87 a barrel  its lowest close in 12 months.
Natural gas rose eight cents but remained at year-ago levels, just below $7 per million Btu. The dollar gained on the euro, but lost ground vs. the yen.
Prudential Financial (PRU) plunged 23%, down 10.02 to 33.27 after sharply reducing its Q3 guidance. The move left shares at their lowest mark since 2003.
Exxon Mobil (XOM) spilled 9 to 68, down 12% on falling oil prices.
The integrated energy heavyweight had been struggling to hold its 10-week average, but the slip left it 12% below the line.
Intuitive Surgical (ISRG) dropped 17.78, or 9%, to 172.85. The maker of robotic surgical instruments is at its lowest point since July 2007, and 36% below its 10-week moving average.
3:15 p.m. Update: Stocks Near Lows In Late Trade
By VINCENT MAO
Stocks worsened and were near session lows with just over an hour left in Thursday's session.
At 2:44 p.m. EDT, the NYSE composite dumped 2.7%, S&P 500 2%, Dow 1.6% and Nasdaq 0.9%.
Turnover was tracking lower across the board.
Gold futures settled at $886.50 an ounce, down $20.

American International Group (AIG) dropped 0.58, or 18%, to 2.61 in heavy trading. Lawmakers are calling for the insurance giant to reimburse the government for spending more than $440,000 for lodging expenses at the St. Regis resort in Monarch Bay, Calif. Apparently, this took place just days after the company received an $85 billion federal bailout. AIG canceled a meeting at a Ritz-Carlton in California's Half Moon Bay.
Omrix Biopharma (OMRI) tumbled 5.95, or 33% to a two-year low of 11.86. The biotech halted a phase two trial of its Fibrin Pad product to investigate an incident of post-operative bleeding.
Ezcorp (EZPW) shed 1.19 to 12.69 and sliced its 200-day moving average. The pawnshop operator broke out in late September, but quickly faltered.
On the upside, FTI consulting (FCN) climbed 1.37 to 39.40 in active trading. It bucked market weakness for a second session.
1:15 p.m. Update: Comeback Efforts Crumble In Midday Trade
By VINCENT MAO
A rebound attempt waned in midday trading Thursday. The Nasdaq had been outperforming its peers, but it slipped back into negative territory after turning positive.
At 12:46 p.m. EDT, the NYSE composite had tumbled 1.9%, the S&P 500 1.3% and the Dow 1.1%. The Nasdaq edged down 0.1%; it was up as much as 2.7% at session highs.
Volume was again tracking lower across the board.
Financials came under fire as the short-sale ban ended Wednesday night.
Morgan Stanley (MS) tumbled 2.40, or 15%, to 14.40 in heavy trading.

Hard-hit by the financial crisis, the former investment bank recently agreed to sell a 20% stake of itself to Japan's Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group for $9 billion. The deal is expected to close Oct. 14
Wachovia (WB) fell 0.88, or 18%, to 4.18 in active trading. According to media reports, talks between Citigroup (C) and Wells Fargo (WFC) for Wachovia's assets have stalled.
Credit Suisse Group (CS) swooned 6.40, or 15%, to 36.40 in busy trade. That's the Swiss investment bank's lowest level in nearly four years.
On the bright side, McDonald's (MCD) jumped 1.75 to 55.16 as it bounced back from a seven-month low. The fast-food giant reports earnings Oct. 22. Profit is slated to rise 17% to 97 cents per share.
11:15 a.m. Update: Major Indexes Give Up Early Gains
By ALAN R. ELLIOTT
Indexes blinked into the red as ailing financials obliterated an early boost gained from decent jobs data and a solid earnings report from IBM.

The NYSE composite and the S&P 500 were off 1.6% and 1.4%, respectively, at 11 a.m. EDT. The Dow showed a 1% loss. The Nasdaq composite was fractionally lower as two Nasdaq 100 telecoms, Millicom International (MICC) and Research In Motion (RIMM), posted healthy gains.
Volume remained lower vs. yesterday's strong levels, down 25% on the NYSE and 40% on the Nasdaq.

Crude oil futures were down slightly to just below $88 a barrel. The dollar rose, as did a broad range of commodities. Gold tumbled more than $20 to $886.10 an ounce. Natural gas slipped a nickel to $6.68 per million cubic feet in its sixth straight day of declines.
JPMorgan Chase (JPM) tacked on 1.15 to trade at 40.55 in strong action. The bank continues to struggle to hold above its 10-week moving average.
Research In Motion (RIMM) mustered a 2.62 jump to 60.22. It is in the second day of an attempt to bounce after a perilous seven-week sell-off.
CF Industries Holdings (CF) powered up 3.65 to 60.96. The fertilizer maker is also working to rebound after a sell-off that dragged its stock price back to 2007 levels.

On the downside, BB&T (BBT) fell 4.53 to 28.48 in fast trade. The drop may have been linked to a Friedman Billings Ramsey report that forecast increasing losses linked to commercial loans. The report said investors had thus far failed to factor in such potential losses to stock values among regional banks. The move thrust BB&T well below both its 10- and 40-week lines of support for the first time since July.
Markets in Asia were mixed. In China, the Shanghai composite held to a relatively mild 0.8% loss, while Hong Kong's Hang Seng index raced 3.3% higher, ending a sharp two-day slide.
Japan's Nikkei 225 eased 0.5%. In India, the Bombay Stock Exchange's BSE 30 toppled 3.1%.

European and U.K. markets moved generally higher in late trading on rebounding banks and commodities. The CAC-40 in Paris rumbled ahead 2.2%, while Frankfurt's DAX jumped 1.2%. The FTSE 100 in London chalked up a 1.3% gain.
Brazil's Bovespa spiked more than 4% at its opening, led by state-owned oil producer Petrobras (PBR) and iron ore miner CVRD (RIO), but it eased to a 2.6% gain in late-morning trading.
10:15 a.m. Update: Stocks Up Strong, But Volume Soft
By VINCENT MAO
Stocks opened higher and strengthened Thursday as IBM announced better-than-expected earnings.
At 9:54 a.m. EDT, the Nasdaq was up 2.2% and the NYSE composite 1.9%.
The S&P 500 climbed 1.8%, retaking the 1,000 level. The Dow also climbed 1.8%.
Turnover was tracking sharply lower across the board.
Bank of America (BAC) gained 1.06, or 5%, to 23.16 after Robert W.
Baird & Co. raised the stock to outperform from neutral, citing valuation.

National City Corp. (NCC) rose 0.33, or 15%, to 2.56 on a report that the bank is in talks to sell itself. PNC Financial Services (PNC) and Bank of Nova Scotia (BNS) have been named as potential suitors.
Meanwhile, Buckle (BKE) gapped up and gained 4.05, or 9%, to 51.25 in fast trade. The apparel retailer bucked the trend of weak sales as it reported a 19.7% surge in September same-store sales.
On the downside, American International Group (AIG) faded from a higher open. It slumped 0.44, or 13%, to 2.75
9:15 a.m. Update: Big Blue Boosts Stock Futures
By VINCENT MAO
Stock futures signaled a higher open Thursday, thanks in part to strong earnings from IBM.
Nasdaq futures rose 11 points vs. fair value, S&P 500 futures gained 11 points and Dow futures climbed 118 points.
According to a media report, the Bush Administration in considering taking ownership in private banks to deal with the worst financial debacle in decades. Some lawmakers voiced support for the idea.

"This idea would, at a minimum, complement the administration's planned approach of buying up troubled assets and may prove to be the most promising tool of all in Secretary Paulson's kit," said Sen. Charles Schumer, D-NY.
Despite a number of measures by the government and the Fed, stocks have been thrashed in recent weeks. This week the major indexes have lost more than 10% each.

International Business Machines (IBM) late Wednesday preannounced third-quarter profit of $2.05 a share, up 22% from the prior year and 4 cents above views. Sales grew 5% to $25.3 billion, missing views.
Big Blue also affirmed its full-year outlook of $8.75 a share. The stock gained 5% in the pre-market.
Other tech bellwethers climbed in pre-open action. Research In Motion (RIMM) gained 4%, while Apple (AAPL) and Hewlett-Packard (HPQ) rose 2% each.

The Federal Reserve will lend American International Group (AIG) an additional $37.8 billion in cash in exchange for investment grade, fixed income securities. Last month, the government bailed out the troubled insurer with a two-year, $85 billion loan. AIG rallied 5% in the pre-market.

Eastman Chemical (EMN) also gained 5% in pre-market trading after saying its Q3 earnings will top analysts' estimates. It cited a recent drop in energy and material costs. Eastman reports results on Oct. 23.
In economic news, initial jobless claims fell by 20,000 to 478,000 in the week ended Oct. 4, as the impact of the recent hurricanes eased.

That was slightly higher than expectations of 475,000.5:15 p.m. Update: Stocks plummeted Thursday, as regulators around the globe struggled to control damage in financial markets.The NYSE composite spiraled 7.9% lower, bringing its two-week loss through Thursday to 26%. 5:15 p.m. Update: After-hours activity made for a potentially good formula for Thursday's open.
Priceline.com (PCLN) beat earnings expectations and gave a bullish outlook. The stock  one of the market's strongest leaders  was up 7% and was among the most active in evening trading.
Hewlett-Packard (HPQ) also topped views. The tech giant's shares were modestly higher in after-hours trading.

While both results were encouraging, the market will also look for some key economic data early Thursday. At 8:30 a.m. EST, both the producer price index and latest jobless claims data will be released.
Among noteworthy earnings, Wal-Mart (WMT) and Lumber Liquidators (LL) are set to announce results Thursday.
U.S. Stocks Finish Higher; Trading Is Heavy
BY PATRICK CAIN
4:15 p.m. Update: Stocks added to Tuesday's big gains with a moderate uptick. This time, however, they did so with volume rising across the board.
The Dow and S&P 500 gained 0.4% each. The Nasdaq led the major indexes with a 0.5% pop. The NYSE composite rose 0.3%.

Overall, the best group of the day was Leisure-Movie & Rentals. Discover Communications (DISCA) was the group's best performer, adding 9% in heavy trade. The move pushed it back above its 10-week line, which it has traded below since late January. Traders were buying the cable TV station on news that Standard & Poor's is adding it to the S&P 500, replacing Pepsi Bottling Group (PBG).
Meanwhile, Coinstar (CSTR) rose 5%. At the session's high the stock was up 10%. But it found resistance at its 200-day moving average.

One of the high-volume movers on the day was Whole Foods Market (WFMI). The upscale grocery store surged 13%. After Tuesday's close, the company reported fiscal first-quarter earnings of 32 cents a share, topping Wall Street estimates for 26 cents.
U.S. Stocks, Volume Hold Levels
BY PATRICK CAIN
3:15 p.m. Update: Stocks remained higher as volume was on pace to end up as well.
The Dow, the Nasdaq and the S&P 500 each gained 0.3%. The NYSE composite rose 0.2%. Volume was up in the 7% to 10% range.

China Agritech (CAGC) continues to march higher. The small cap Chinese fertilizer firm jumped 10%. The stock is hitting a new high after clearing a five-week consolidation. Trading picked up Tuesday after Norway's Yara International (YARIY) said it will pay $4.1 billion for Sioux City, Iowa-based Terra Industries (TRA).

On the downside Rick's Cabaret (RICK) couldn't hold its gains after a premature breakout Tuesday; the general market remains in correction, which means any buy is premature. The stock was in a four-week consolidation that may have been a square-box base. If so, four weeks is OK. If it is a flat base, then it is too short. So far the company has lost 8% and triggered its 8% sell rule earlier in the session.
U.S. Stocks Modestly Higher As NYSE Lags

5:15 p.m. Update:  Stocks extended their winning ways Tuesday following a round of mostly upbeat economic data.
Action was choppy throughout the session, but most indexes still nabbed their fourth straight advance.
The Dow led the pack, rising 0.4%. Caterpillar (CAT), Travelers (TRV) and JPMorgan Chase (JPM) were the blue-chip index's biggest point gainers.
Meanwhile, the S&P and Nasdaq headed further north of their milestone levels. They gained 0.3% and 0.1%, respectively. The NYSE composite ticked up less than 0.1%.
Volume climbed slightly on both exchanges, according to preliminary data.

WMS Industries (WMS) gapped up and surged 13% to an all-time high. Late Monday, the gaming equipment maker delivered fiscal Q4 earnings above views and guided fiscal 2010 sales ahead of analysts' estimates. Tuesday morning, JPMorgan raised shares to overweight from neutral. The stock cleared a double-bottom base July 23.
Chinese issues continued to be some of the market's best performers.
Rino International (RINO) rallied 7% to an all-time high on about four times average trade. The company makes pollution-control products for the steel industry.
E-House (EJ) ran 7% to its highest levels since January 2008. The real estate broker reports earnings Aug. 12. Analysts see profit rising 14% to 16 cents a share.

Elsewhere, Valeant Pharmaceuticals (VRX) gained 5% as it emerged from a pullback to its 50-day moving average. Earlier Tuesday, the drugmaker reported its third straight quarter of triple-digit earnings growth. Analysts expect another three-digit gain this period.

On the downside, STEC (STEC) gapped down and fell 8% in more than double its average trade. The memory products maker suffered its biggest hit in months as news of a stock offering offset a strong Q2 report.

Earnings Wednesday: Activision Blizzard (ATVI), Agrium (AGU), Almost Family (AFAM), Ameristar Casinos (ASCA), Athenahealth (ATHN), Baker Hughes (BHI), Boyd Gaming (BYD), Career Education (CECO), Cisco Systems (CSCO), Concur Technologies (CNQR), Dean Foods (DF), Devon Energy (DVN), Garmin (GRMN), J2 Global Communications (JCOM), Lincoln Educational Services (LINC), Lumber Liquidators (LL), Ninety-Nine Cents Only Stores (NDN), Petrohawk Energy (HK), PetroQuest Energy (PQ), Procter & Gamble (PG) and Tekelec (TKLC).
The ADP employment survey, ISM services index and factory orders will also be out Wednesday.
4:15 p.m. Update: Stocks Rise In Seesaw Session
BY VINCENT MAO
Major indexes extended gains following a choppy session Tuesday.
The Dow climbed 0.4% and the S&P 500 0.3%. The Nasdaq and the NYSE composite rose 0.1% each.
According to preliminary data, volume edged higher on both exchanges.
Hotel operators, gaming equipment makers and REITs were the session's top performers. Commodity-related groups, e-commerce and retailers were among Tuesday's worst performers.
3:15 p.m. Update: Blue Chips Lead Late Rebound
BY VINCENT MAO
Stocks regained some lost ground but were still narrowly mixed late in Tuesday's session.

The Dow rose 0.2%, thanks again to Caterpillar (CAT) and Travelers (TRV). Even General Electric (GE) rose a fraction despite agreeing to pay the Securities and Exchange Commission $50 million to settle allegations of fraud.
Meanwhile, the S&P 500 edged up 0.1%, while the Nasdaq and NYSE composite were flat.
Volume was tracking slightly higher across the board.

Valeant Pharmaceuticals (VRX) climbed 4% to a seven-year high. Before the open, the specialty drugmaker smashed views with a 920% pop in Q2 earnings. Sales grew 25%, also above views. Valeant guided full-year profit above analysts' estimates. It emerged from a recent pullback to its 50-day moving average.

On the downside, Ctrip.com International (CTRP) slipped a fraction ahead of its earnings after the close. The Chinese travel services provider is expected to earn 29 cents a share, down 8% from a year ago.

Likewise, Pegasystems (PEGA) eased ahead of its Q2 results after the close. The business software maker is slated to earn 11 cents a share on sales of $59.2 million. Last week, Pegasystems cleared a 27.59 buy point from a double-bottom base.
2:15 p.m. Update: Stocks Lose Steam In Afternoon Trade
BY VINCENT MAO
Major indexes turned mixed with a couple of hours left in Tuesday's trade.
The NYSE composite reversed a small gain and lost 0.2%. The Nasdaq slipped a fraction. Meanwhile, the Dow and the S&P 500 were mostly unchanged.
Volume was tracking about even on the NYSE and slightly lower on the Nasdaq.

Grand Canyon Education (LOPE) rallied 6% to its best levels in more than five months. Late Monday, the for-profit educator reported Q2 results above views and raised its full-year forecast for earnings and sales.
1:15 p.m. Update: Indexes Tick Higher; Nasdaq Turns Positive
BY VINCENT MAO
Stocks improved in early afternoon trading Tuesday. Even the Nasdaq joined its peers in positive territory, but overall gains were modest.
The Dow rose 0.3%. Gains in Caterpillar (CAT) and Travelers (TRV) boosted the index. The S&P 500 gained 0.3% and the NYSE composite 0.1%.
Meanwhile, the Nasdaq turned fractionally higher after falling 0.7%.
Turnover continued to track lower on both major exchanges.

Home Inns & Hotels Management (HMIN) erased early losses and vaulted 11% to a 52-week high in heavy trading. It cleared a 17.91 buy point from a cup-with-handle base. The Chinese hotel operator reports earnings Wednesday. Analysts see profit rising 30% to 13 cents a share.
Cubic (CUB) reversed higher, climbing 2% in fast trade. The military gear maker won a three-year contract from Rockwell-Collins (COL) worth more than $8 million.

On the downside, Herbalife (HLF) gapped down and slumped 13%, nearly touching its 50-day moving average. Late Monday, the nutritional supplements firm reported smaller-than-expected declines in Q2 results but guided Q3 profit below views. The company also narrowed its full-year earnings outlook.
12:15 p.m. Update:Stocks Mixed, But Several Leaders Fare Well
BY JONAH KERI
The major indexes were flat at midday Tuesday, while several leading stocks fared well.
The Dow and the S&P were both flat. On the downside, the Nasdaq and NYSE composite both lost 0.2%.
Volume slipped across the board. It fell 10% on the NYSE and 11% on the Nasdaq compared with the same period Monday.

Universal Travel (UTA) rose 4% in nearly four times its normal trade. The China-based travel services provider has built on its gains since staging a big breakout from a short consolidation on July 28.
BJ's Restaurants (BJRI) gained 5% in close to triple its typical turnover. The restaurant operator is working on a 14-week base and sits 6% off its 52-week high.

On the downside, STEC (STEC) dropped 8% in heavy volume. The chipmaker's stock gapped down at the open. STEC topped Q2 earnings estimates after Monday's close, but its top executive are selling shares through a stock offering.
11:15 a.m. Update: Stocks Dip; A Few Leaders Make New Highs

5:15 p.m. Update:  Stocks extended their winning ways Tuesday following a round of mostly upbeat economic data.Action was choppy throughout the session, but most indexes still nabbed their fourth straight advance.The Dow led the pack, rising 0.4%. Caterpillar (CAT), Travelers (TRV) and JPMorgan Chase (JPM) were the blue-chip index's biggest point gainers.Meanwhile, the S&P and Nasdaq headed further north of their milestone levels. They gained 0.3% and 0.1%, respectively. The NYSE composite ticked up less than 0.1%.Volume climbed slightly on both exchanges, according to preliminary data.WMS Industries (WMS) gapped up and surged 13% to an all-time high. Analysts see profit rising 14% to 16 cents a share.Elsewhere, Valeant Pharmaceuticals (VRX) gained 5% as it emerged from a pullback to its 50-day moving average. 5:15 p.m. Update: Investors returned from the weekend in buying mode Monday, sending the major stock indexes to their best levels in months. Better-than-forecasted housing and construction spending data helped sentiment.

The NYSE composite sprinted 4.2% to a four-month high, thanks in part to financials. Wells Fargo (WFC) surged 23%, Bank of America (BAC) 19% and PNC Financial Services (PNC) 13%. Results from "stress tests" on 19 of the nation's biggest banks will be released Thursday.

Meanwhile, the S&P 500 climbed 3.4% to its first close above the 900 mark in four months. The Dow tacked on 2.6%. The Nasdaq also rallied 2.6% and regained its 200-day moving average. It had been trading under the line since August.
Volume climbed on both exchanges.
Among leaders, Allegiant Travel (ALGT) rallied 9% in above-average volume. The low-cost carrier reported a near 33% rise in April traffic. But shares fell 4% after hours on news of a stock offering.

Longtop Financial Technologies (LFT) added nearly 6% to its best levels since November 2007. The Chinese financial software maker extended gains after bouncing off its 10-week moving average last week.

Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR) reversed early losses and rose 2% in heavy trading. The coffee distributor perked up despite Longbow cutting shares to neutral from buy. Green Mountain sits 32% above a 55.71 buy point from a three-weeks tight pattern.
The sole piece of economic data for Tuesday will be the ISM Services index.

Earnings to be announced Tuesday: Archer Daniels Midland (ADM), Avon Products (AVP), Centex (CTX), Cephalon (CEPH), CVS Caremark (CVS), Emergency Medical Services (EMS), IntercontinentalExchange (ICE), J2 Global Communications (JCOM), Marvel Entertainment (MVL), Molson Coors Brewing (TAP), Pantry (PTRY), RiskMetrics (RMG), Steven Madden (SHOO), Teva Pharmaceuticals (TEVA) and Walt Disney (DIS).
4:15 p.m. Update: Stocks Surge In Heavier Volume
BY VINCENT MAO
Stocks rallied sharply Monday, boosted by better-than-expected economic data. Indexes finished near session highs.
The NYSE composite ran 4.2% and S&P 500 3.4%. The Dow and Nasdaq picked up 2.6% each.
Volume increased on both exchanges. Advancers trounced decliners 5-to-1 on the NYSE and over 3-to-1 on the Nasdaq.
Banks, homebuilders and alternative energy issues were the best performers. Insurance and consulting issues slipped.
3:15 p.m. Update: NYSE Composite, S&P 500 Extend Gains
BY VINCENT MAO
Stocks hovered near the best levels of the session in late trading Monday.

The NYSE composite and S&P 500 gained 3.3% and 2.5%, respectively. Meanwhile, the Dow rose 2.2%, with 29 of 30 issues in the plus column. The Nasdaq climbed 1.7% but stalled after hitting its 200-day moving average again. The Dow and Nasdaq have yet to score new intraday highs.
Volume continued to track sharply higher across the board.

Ebix (EBIX) rallied 8% to a seven-month high. The provider of software and e-commerce services to the insurance industry reports earnings Wednesday. Ebix is a thin stock, trading only about 100,000 shares each day.

Powell Industries (POWL) tacked on 6% in active trading. The stock shaped a handle, but the handle is low within the base, making it failure-prone. Powell reports fiscal Q2 results Wednesday. Analysts see earnings rising 32% to 70 cents a share.
On the downside, FTI Consulting (FCN) dropped 8% and sliced its 200-day moving average. That wiped out the bulk of gains from the past three sessions.
2:15 p.m. Update: Indexes Rebound; NYSE Composite Leads
BY VINCENT MAO
Stocks bounced back from a midday dip with about a couple of hours left in Monday's trade. Two major indexes hit session highs, while the others were close to doing so.
The NYSE composite etched a new intraday peak. It rallied 3.1%, thanks to gains in homebuilders, coal, bank and steel issues. The S&P 500 also scored a new session high, rising 2.4%.
Meanwhile, the Dow gained 2.2%. The Nasdaq lagged with a 1.8% gain. This comes despite a 4.8% jump in the Philadelphia Semiconductor Index.
Turnover was still running vastly higher on both exchanges.

Lancaster Colony (LANC) rallied 8% to an all-time high in heavy trading. It bounced back from several tests of its 50-day moving average last month. The company makes specialty foods, glasswares and candles. Last week, it smashed views with a 171% surge in fiscal Q3 profit, but sales grew only 7%.
Carter's (CRI) rose 6% in fast trade, marking its third straight advance. But the children's apparel retailer is still recovering from a heavy-volume hit on April 29.

Changyou.com (CYOU) pared a 17% gain to 6%. Before the open, the Chinese online gaming firm delivered a 97% jump in Q1 earnings, beating views. Sales grew 50%, but that's down from triple-to-quadruple figures in the prior six quarters.

On the downside, DirecTV (DTV) fell 4%, but appeared to have found support at its 200-day moving average. The satellite TV provider will join forces with Liberty Media's entertainment unit that will be spun off into a new publicly traded company.
1:15 p.m. Update: Indexes Retreat In Afternoon Trading
BY VINCENT MAO
Stocks pulled back in early afternoon trading after running higher all morning.
The NYSE composite was up 2.6%, but down from 3% at its session high. The S&P 500 climbed 1.9%, Dow 1.8% and Nasdaq 1.5%.
Volume was again tracking sharply higher across the board. Advancers beat decliners by about 3-to-1 on both exchanges.
Financials rose ahead of stress-tests results from the government Thursday.
Wells Fargo (WFC) jumped 9% despite reports that regulators asked the bank to raise more capital.

Meantime, Beacon Roofing Supply (BECN) added 3% to a near eight-month high. It followed through after clearing a 15.15 buy point from a cup base Friday. The company reports earnings Friday. Analysts are expecting a loss of 11 cents a share.
HMS Holdings (HMSY) rose 4% in brisk volume. The provider of cost-control services is nearing a 36.45 buy point from a cup base. But the pattern has more distribution than accumulation.

On the downside, Adobe Systems (ADBE) gapped down and fell 5% following two downgrades. Citigroup cut the software maker to hold from buy, while UBS dropped shares to neutral from buy. Both firms cited valuation. Adobe ran into resistance at its 200-day moving average Friday.
12:15 p.m.: Stocks Up Sharply At Midday
BY JONAH KERI
The major indexes retained big gains in higher volume at midday Monday.
The tech-laden Nasdaq composite climbed 1.6%. The S&P 500 and Dow industrials both rose 2.1%. The NYSE composite vaulted 2.7% and the small-cap S&P 600 2.3%.
Volume picked up across the board. It climbed 26% on the NYSE and 18% on the Nasdaq compared with the same period Friday.
Chipotle Mexican Grill (CMG) advanced 4% in brisk trade. The Mexican fast food chain is working on the right side of a deep base started in January 2008.
Fellow restaurant chain Panera Bread (PNRA) rose 5% in nearly twice its typical volume. The stock is trying to rebound after gapping down 12% Wednesday following a disappointing earnings report.
Ross Stores (ROST) rose 2% in above-average turnover. The discount retail chain sits 6% off a 52-week high.

On the downside, telecom equipment maker Neutral Tandem  (TNDM) fell 3% in double its regular trade. The stock pared its robust recent gains after BWS Financial downgraded Neutral Tandem to hold from a buy rating.
11:15 a.m.: Major Indexes Extend Gains
BY JONAH KERI
The market tacked on more gains Monday, in higher volume.
The tech-laden Nasdaq composite climbed 1.7%. The S&P 500 and Dow industrials both rose 2.2%. The NYSE composite vaulted 2.6% and the small-cap S&P 600 2.4%.
Volume picked up across the board. It climbed 33% on the NYSE and 18% on the Nasdaq compared with the same period Friday.
Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD) climbed 4% in brisk trade. The casual restaurant chain is trying to rally after three straight losses dragged the stock down to near its 50-day moving average.
DG FastChannel (DGIT) advanced 2% in above-average volume. The digital network operator broke out of a cup-with-handle base on April 17.
Red Hat (RHT) gained 5% in rapid turnover. UBS upgraded the open-source operating system provider to a buy from a neutral rating.
Beacon Roofing Supply (BECN) leapt 4%, on pace for a fifth straight day of gains. The provider of roofing and building materials is slated to report fiscal second-quarter earnings later this week.
Aeropostale (ARO) ramped up 6% in nearly twice its usual trade. The clothing retail chain announced last week that it cut 170 jobs.

5:15 p.m. Update: Stocks rallied Wednesday, shaking off a worse-than-expected read in first-quarter GDP. Reassuring comments from the Federal Reserve about a slowdown in economic contraction also boosted sentiment. And major indexes climbed despite news of the first U.S. death from swine flu.
The NYSE composite and S&P 500 climbed 2.7% and 2.2% respectively. Both hit three-month highs. The Nasdaq pushed to a new five-month high, gaining 2.3%. Meanwhile, the Dow rose 2.1%.
Turnover climbed sharply across the board.
Peet's Coffee & Tea (PEET) gapped up and rallied nearly 9% in over triple its average volume. The stock rallied despite a mixed Q1 report released late Tuesday.

FTI Consulting (FCN) gapped up and jumped 9% in about double its average trade. The company reported Q1 earnings and sales above views. But the stock closed just below its 200-day moving average after poking above it intraday.

Thoratec (THOR) added 6% in heavy trading. The provider of circulatory support products followed through after clearing a 28.16 buy point from a handle Tuesday. But as noted in a recent IBD base analysis column, volume in Thoratec's base was questionable, and the stock's Relative Strength line has lagged.
On the downside, some leaders got hurt.

Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD) dropped about 6% in nearly four times average trade. Late Tuesday, the sports bar and grill operator delivered Q1 results above views. But its full-year sales growth forecast came in soft.
Panera Bread (PNRA) and Advent Software (ADVS) tumbled 12% and 3% respectively, despite upbeat earnings reports.

Elsewhere, AstraZeneca (AZN), Capella Education (CPLA), Celgene (CELG), Colgate-Palmolive (CL), Corinthian Colleges (COCO), Dow Chemical (DOW), General Motors (GM), Motorola (MOT), Neutral Tandem (TNDM), Procter & Gamble (PG) and Strayer Education (STRA) will all report earnings Thursday.
4:15 p.m. Update: Stocks Bounce Back On Higher Trade
BY VINCENT MAO
Stocks rebounded from a two-session pullback Wednesday, but a late-day retreat trimmed a chunk of the day's gains.

The NYSE composite closed up 2.7%, down from a 3.6% gain at the session's peak. The Nasdaq rallied 2.3%. At its intraday high, the tech-rich index was about 35 points below its 200-day moving average. Meanwhile, the S&P 500 climbed 2.2%, and the Dow rose 2.1%.
According to preliminary data, volume climbed sharply on both exchanges. Advancers trounced decliners by more than 5-to-1 on the NYSE and better than 3-to-1 on the Nasdaq.
Banks and alternative-energy issues scored nice gains. Apparel and a number of retail issues sold off.
3:15 p.m. Update: Indexes Retreat In Late Trade
BY VINCENT MAO
Major indexes stepped back to pre-Fed-announcement levels after touching new session highs in late trade Wednesday.
Still, stocks were on pace to snap a two-session pullback.
The NYSE composite rallied 2.9%, the Nasdaq 2.6%, the S&P 500 2.4% and the Dow 2.3%.
Volume was tracking higher across the board, especially on the Nasdaq.
Visa (V) rose 3% ahead of its earnings after the bell. Analysts see the credit card firm's profit rising 23% to 64 cents a share.
Express Scripts (ESRX) also reports after the closing bell. The pharmacy benefits manager is expected to earn 82 cents a share on sales of $5.4 billion.
2:45 p.m. Update: Stocks Maintain Rally After Fed Statement
BY ED CARSON AND VINCENT MAO
Stocks held fast to impressive gains after the Federal Reserve kept rates at record lows and said the economy's "pace of contraction appears to be somewhat slower."
Policymakers quickly added in the post-meeting statement that "economic activity is likely to remain weak for some time."
As expected, the Fed left its fed funds target rate at a record-low 0%-0.25%. It expects rates and inflation to remain low for some time.

The Fed said it would use all tools available to bolster growth. It reaffirmed plans to buy up to $300 billion in Treasuries by autumn, as well as $1.25 trillion in agency mortgage-backed securities and up to $200 billion in agency debt by year-end.
At 2:25 p.m. EDT, the NYSE composite was up 2.9%, the Nasdaq 2.5%, the S&P 500 2.4% and the Dow 2.3%. Volume was higher on the Nasdaq but lower on the NYSE.
Bank stocks were notable gainers after Fox-Pitt Kelton raised the sector's rating for the first time in five years. The broker upgraded banks to market weight from underweight.
In individual stocks, Peet's Coffee & Tea (PEET) gapped up and gained 6% to a six-month high despite mixed Q1 results. Late Tuesday, the company beat views with a 53% jump in earnings. Sales missed.
Rival Starbucks (SBUX) rose nearly 3% ahead of its earnings after the close.
Medco Health Solutions (MHS) trimmed a nearly 8% deficit to 3%. Before the open, the pharmacy benefits manager reported Q1 results that beat expectations. It also backed its full-year profit outlook.
1:15 p.m. Update: Stocks Pull Back In Early Afternoon Trading

5:15 p.m. Update: Stocks rallied Wednesday, shaking off a worse-than-expected read in first-quarter GDP. Reassuring comments from the Federal Reserve about a slowdown in economic contraction also boosted sentiment. And major indexes climbed despite news of the first U.S. death from swine flu.The NYSE composite and S&P 500 climbed 2.7% and 2.2% respectively. Both hit three-month highs. The Nasdaq pushed to a new five-month high, gaining 2.3%. Meanwhile, the Dow rose 2.1%.Turnover climbed sharply across the board.Peet's Coffee & Tea (PEET) gapped up and rallied nearly 9% in over triple its average volume. The stock rallied despite a mixed Q1 report released late Tuesday.FTI Consulting (FCN) gapped up and jumped 9% in about double its average trade. The company reported Q1 earnings and sales above views. But the stock closed just below its 200-day moving average after poking above it intraday.Thoratec (THOR) added 6% in heavy trading. The provider of circulatory support products followed through after clearing a 28.16 buy point from a handle Tuesday. But as noted in a recent IBD base analysis column, volume in Thoratec's base was questionable, and the stock's Relative Strength line has lagged.On the downside, some leaders got hurt.Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD) dropped about 6% in nearly four times average trade. 5:15 p.m. Update: Stocks finished lower for a second straight session Tuesday as more cases of swine flu and bank worries offset a spike in consumer confidence. Trading was choppy for the bulk of the session.

The NYSE composite lost 0.4%, while the Nasdaq and S&P 500 slipped 0.3% each. The Dow fell a milder 0.1%, thanks to IBM (IBM), which raised its dividend and approved an additional $3 billion stock buyback. Big Blue rose 2%.
Volume dropped on both exchanges  a good sign that professionals didn't dump shares.

Brink's Home Security (CFL) fell 7% in heavy trading, snapping a three-session advance. It was the biggest percentage decliner in the IBD 100. The downturn left the stock slightly above a 25.82 buy point from a cup-with-handle pattern.

Longtop Financial Technologies (LFT) fell 3% in double average trade. It was down as much as 10% at its session low. The Chinese financial software firm late Monday announced an acquisition and filed to sell 16 million shares.
On the upside, Aaron's (AAN) gapped up and surged 17% in huge volume. Late Monday, the rental firm easily beat views with a 55% jump in Q1 earnings. It also raised its full-year profit outlook.
Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR) reversed losses and rallied nearly 5% to a record high. The stock cleared a 55.71 buy point from a three-weeks-tight pattern.
Elsewhere, GDP numbers and the Fed's decision on interest rates will be out Wednesday.

Earnings due: Aetna (AET), ArcelorMittal (MT), Burger King (BKC), Citrix Systems (CTXS), Express Scripts (ESRX), FTI Consulting (FCN), General Dynamics (GD), MedAssets (MDAS), Medco Health Solutions (MHS), Moody's (MCO), O'Reilly Automotive (ORLY), SAP (SAP) and Visa (V).
4:15 p.m. Update: Indexes Seesaw To Lower Close
BY VINCENT MAO
Major indexes finished lower after a seesaw session Tuesday. More cases of swine flu and bank fears trumped a jump in consumer confidence.
The NYSE composite fell 0.4% and the Dow 0.1%. The Nasdaq and S&P 500 lost 0.3% each.
According to preliminary data, volume fell across the board. Advancers edged out decliners on both exchanges.
Financials, steel and metal stocks were among the biggest decliners. Home furnishing and apparel makers bucked the trend.
3:15 p.m. Update: Stocks Find Direction In Late Trade
BY VINCENT MAO
After struggling for direction for most of the session, three of the four major indexes pushed to new session highs in late trade Tuesday.

The Dow rallied 0.8%, led by gains in IBM (IBM), Exxon Mobil (XOM) and Chevron (CVX). The S&P 500 and NYSE composite climbed 0.7% and 0.6%, respectively. Meanwhile, the Nasdaq rose 0.6%, but it didn't hit a new session high.
Volume was slightly lower across the board.

Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD) rose 4% to a seven-month high in brisk trade. The sports bar and grill chain reports Q1 results after the close. Analysts are expecting earnings of 46 cents a share on sales of $129.1 million.

On the downside, Dendreon (DNDN) plunged 45% after having a huge change of heart. The biotech was up 16% earlier in the session after data from a study showed that its Provenge prostate drug extended survival rates vs. a placebo. Shares have been halted since about 1:30 p.m. EDT.
Advent Software (ADVS) slipped 2% ahead of its earnings report, which is expected after the close.
2:15 p.m. Update: Stocks Trim Gains In Lackluster Trading
BY VINCENT MAO
Major stock indexes pared some gains and turned narrowly mixed in afternoon trading Tuesday. Market action continued to be choppy.
The Dow rose 0.3%, thanks largely to a jump in IBM (IBM). The S&P 500 edged up 0.1%, while the Nasdaq and NYSE composite were flat.
Turnover was tracking lower on both exchanges.

Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR) reversed losses and perked up 5% to a fresh all-time high. The stock cleared a 55.71 buy point from a three-weeks tight pattern. Green Mountain reports earnings after Wednesday's close. Analysts see profit rising 38% to 36 cents a share.

On the downside, Brink's Home Security Holdings (CFL) fell 6% as it pulled back after three sessions of nice gains. The drop left the stock just above a 25.82 buy point from a cup-with-handle pattern.

Baidu.com (BIDU) reversed and shed about 1% in heavy trading. The Chinese Internet search firm was up more than 5% following its strong Q1 results late Monday. Earlier Tuesday, Needham upgraded the stock from underperform to hold, while Pali Research upgraded it from sell to neutral.
1:15 p.m. Update: Stocks Rebound In Choppy Trading
BY VINCENT MAO
Stocks bounced back in early afternoon trading after a brief dip in the red. Still, action has been choppy.
The Nasdaq led the pack, rising 0.5%, while the Dow and S&P 500 rose 0.2% each. Meanwhile, the NYSE composite was flat. Losses in metals, steel and financials weighed on the index.
Turnover was tracking slightly lower across the board. Advancers beat decliners by about 3-to-2 on both exchanges.

Changyou.com (CYOU) ramped up 12% to an all-time high. The recent IPO reports earnings May 4. Analysts see the online gaming firm's profit doubling to 60 cents a share. Changyou.com was spun off from Sohu.com (SOHU) earlier this month.
Steven Madden (SHOO) added 5% to a near two-year high. The footwear and accessories maker reports earnings May 5. It preannounced strong results last week.

On the downside, Rent-A-Center (RCII) gapped and tumbled 11% after it delivered lower-than-expected Q1 sales and gave a weak Q2 outlook. Late Monday, the electronics and furniture rental chain said first-quarter revenue fell 4% to $728.2 million vs. views of $733.9 million. It guided second-quarter earnings in line with analysts' estimates. But its sales forecast of $679 million to $694 million fell short of views of $706.9 million. Earlier Tuesday, Sterne Agee cut shares to neutral from buy.

Starent Networks (STAR) fell 5% on a downgrade. Citing valuation, Cantor Fitzgerald cut the maker of infrastructure products to hold from buy. The downturn erased Monday's gains, but the stock didn't undercut its 17.85 buy point.
12:15 p.m. Update: Major Indexes Pull Back Again At Midday
BY JONAH KERI
Stocks faded at midday Tuesday, as an up-and-down morning left the market with mixed results.
The Nasdaq climbed less than 0.1%, while the Dow industrials and S&P 500 both fell 0.3%. Meanwhile, the NYSE composite dropped 0.6% and the small-cap S&P 600 gained 0.9%.
Volume eased across the board. It sank 3% on the NYSE and 4% on the Nasdaq compared with the same period Monday.

Edwards Lifesciences (EW) jumped 9% in nearly five times its normal trade. The maker of products used to treat cardiovascular disorders reported first-quarter earnings that topped Wall Street estimates, while raising its full-year profit forecast. The stock is approaching a potential 63.60 buy point in a base-on-base pattern.
Casual restaurant chain Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD) extended its early gains, climbing 4% in brisk turnover.
Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR) added 2% in above-average volume. The coffee distributor has posted three straight tight weekly closes after breaking out of a base in March.
Tyler Technologies (TYL) leapt 11% in five times its typical turnover. The provider of IT management services beat Q1 earnings views. Tyler's stock has surged to within 9% of its 52-week high.
11:15 a.m. Update: Stocks Turn Higher
BY JONAH KERI
The major market indexes turned early losses into gains Tuesday.
The Nasdaq climbed 0.6%, the Dow industrials advanced 0.5% and the S&P 500 added 0.4%. Meanwhile, the NYSE composite rose 0.2% and the small-cap S&P 600 bounced 0.9%.
Volume eased across the board. It sank 1% on the NYSE and 5% on the Nasdaq compared with the same period Monday.

Rock-Tenn (RKT) jumped 8%, with volume tracking four times above Monday's level. The maker of packaging and merchandising displays smashed fiscal second-quarter earnings views after Monday's close. Rock-Tenn is building the right side of a deep base and now sits 24% off its 52-week high.
Family Dollar Stores (FDO) rose 4% in above-average trade. The deep-discount chain staged a breakaway gap March 5. It's traded in a tight range for the past month.
Express Scripts (ESRX) picked up 2% in rapid turnover. The provider of pharmacy benefit management services has vaulted above its 200-day moving average as it works on the right side of a base.

On the downside, Longtop Financial Technologies (LFT) slid 8% in massive trade. The China-based financial software maker is on pace for a third big drop in heavy volume in the past four sessions. The stock has found support at its 50-day line.
10:15 a.m. Update: Market Pares Losses In Early Trade

5:15 p.m. Update: A day of mixed trading stacked a distribution day against the young rally, despite strong gains by transportation and financial stocks.

Strayer Education (STRA) led the Commercial Services-Schools industry group to a 7% decline after a report from Boston-based consulting firm Off Wall Street identified a potential slowing trend in the company's new applications.
The railroads group notched a 4% gain and air freight carriers rose 3%. Preliminary data shows a late surge left volume firmly higher on both exchanges.
April crude futures recovered after dipping nearly $3 to settle up $1.10 to $47.35 a barrel. The euro held at a five-week high vs. the dollar. The dollar rose against the yen.
Before the market opens Tuesday, the Commerce Department releases February building permits and new housing starts numbers, and the Labor Department releases Producer Price Index numbers.

The dwindling December quarter earnings calendar includes Canadian Solar (CSIQ), Harvest Natural (HNR) and Sirius XM Radio (SIRI) prior the the open. Darden Restaurants (DRI), clothing retailer Guess (GES) and aerospace suppliers AAR (AIR) are scheduled to report after the closing bell.
4:15 p.m. Update: Indexes Tumble Late, Close Mixed
BY JUAN CARLOS ARANCIBIA
A late sell-off Monday snapped the winning streaks of most major indexes.
The NYSE composite closed 0.2% higher, thanks to strength in energy stocks, after giving up most of its gains.
The Nasdaq tumbled 1.9%, the S&P 500 0.4% and the Dow 0.1%. All closed at session lows.
Volume rose, according to preliminary readings. If confirmed, that would give the Nasdaq and the S&P 500 a distribution day.
Selling returned to school stocks, the day's worst-performing industry.
Railroads and other transports climbed after Merrill Lynch upgraded Union Pacific (UNP) to buy from neutral.
3:15 p.m. Update: Transports Outperform As Nasdaq Slips; Volume Mixed

5:15 p.m. Update: Better-than-expected manufacturing and construction data boosted stocks to multimonth highs Monday.
Thanks to chemical, steel and energy issues, the NYSE composite ran 2.2% to its highest since last Oct. 14. The Dow climbed 1.3%.
Meanwhile, the S&P 500 rallied 1.5% and closed above the 1000 mark for the first time since November. The Nasdaq also gained 1.5%, closing above the 2000 level for the first time since Oct. 1.
Volume dropped sharply on the NYSE and slipped on the Nasdaq.
VanceInfo Technology (VIT) gapped up and surged 12% to an all-time high. The Chinese IT services firm reports earnings Aug. 14. Analysts see profit rising 10% to 11 cents a share.

Community Health Systems (CYH) jumped 11% in more than double average trade. The hospital operator rallied on news that the government announced rate increases for inpatient care instead of cuts that regulators had hoped for.
Sirona Dental (SIRO) gapped up and climbed 8% to a 10-month high after an upgrade. But shares fell 5% after hours as the company announced a secondary offering of 7.5 million shares.
Neutral Tandem (TNDM) gapped up and rose 7% to a new high. It cleared a 31.60 buy point from a cup-with-handle base. The telecom services firm reports earnings Thursday.
On the downside, Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR) dropped 4% in heavy trading after announcing a 4-million-share stock offering.

Earnings Tuesday: American Medical (AMMD), American Public Education (APEI), Archer Daniels Midland (ADM), Cameron International (CAM), Cognizant Technology Solutions (CTSH), CVS Caremark (CVS), Emergency Medical Services (EMS), FTI Consulting (FCN), Grand Canyon Education (LOPE), Iconix Brand Group (ICON), Inergy (NRGY), Intercontinental Exchange (ICE), Kraft Foods (KFT), Marvel Entertainment (MVL), Pegasystems (PEGA), Tessera Technology (TSRA), True Religion (TRLG), Valeant Pharmaceuticals (VRX).
Reports on personal income, spending and pending home sales will also be out Tuesday.
4:15 p.m. Update: Stocks Finish Near Highs
BY VINCENT MAO
Indexes tacked on nice gains Monday, closing near session highs.
The NYSE composite rallied 2.2%, while the Nasdaq and the S&P 500 picked up 1.5% each. Meanwhile, the Dow added 1.3%.
According to preliminary data, volume rose on both exchanges.
Metal, steel and energy groups were the day's top performers. Consulting, food and security software makers were the session's worst performers.
3:15 p.m. Update: Stocks Push Ahead In Late Trade
BY VINCENT MAO
Major indexes climbed to new session highs in late trading Monday.
The NYSE composite continued to lead with a 2.2% gain. The S&P 500 was up 1.5%, the Nasdaq 1.3%, the Dow 1.2%.
Volume continued to track higher on both exchanges.

STEC (STEC) pulled back from its intraday peak, but shares were still up 4% ahead of its Q2 report after the close. Analysts see the memory products maker earning 34 cents a share on sales of $83.3 million. Bank of America (BAC) rose 4% to a seven-month high, despite agreeing to a hefty fine. The company will pay $33 million in penalties to settle charges of misleading investors about Merrill Lynch bonuses.
Cubic (CUB) reversed earlier losses and gained 3% in fast trade. The military gear maker is bouncing back after a failed breakout from a cup base.
2:15 p.m. Update: Indexes Improve; Nasdaq, S&P 500 Clear Key Levels
BY VINCENT MAO
Stocks strengthened with two hours left in Monday's trade.
The NYSE composite rallied 2.1%. The S&P 500 passed the 1000 mark for the first time since last November, rising 1.4%.
Meanwhile, the Nasdaq gained 1.2% as it made further headway above the 2000 level. The Dow rose 1.1%.
Volume was again tracking higher on both the NYSE and the Nasdaq.

Sirona Dental (SIRO) gapped up and rallied 7% to a 10-month high on an upgrade. Robert W. Baird raised the dental equipment maker to outperform from neutral. On Friday, the company delivered a 142% surge in fiscal Q3 earnings. Analysts see profit rising 370% in the current quarter.

Clearwater Paper (CLW) pulled back from an all-time high but was still up 4%. The maker of paperboard, tissue and lumber products has delivered two straight quarters of triple digit growth. Analysts expect a 247% jump in full-year earnings.

Ford (F) gapped up and gained 6% to a nine-month high. Thanks to the government's "cash for clunkers" program, the automaker reported a 2.3% uptick in July sales. That is its first monthly increase since November 2007.
1:15 p.m. Update: Nasdaq, S&P 500 Hold Near Key Technical Levels
BY VINCENT MAO
Stocks hovered near session highs in early afternoon trading Monday.
Thanks in part to energy and steel stocks, the NYSE composite rallied 1.7%. But that's down from 2.1% at session highs.
The S&P 500 climbed 1.1% and the Nasdaq 1%. Both were near key technical levels of 1000 and 2000, respectively.
Meanwhile, the Dow was up 0.8%.
Turnover was again tracking higher across the board.

Neutral Tandem (TNDM) gapped up and rallied 6% in heavy trading. It cleared a 31.60 buy point from a cup-with-handle base. The telecom services firm reports earnings Thursday. Analysts see profit running 71% to 29 cents a share, but that's down from five straight quarters of triple-digit growth.
NetEase.com (NTES) gapped up and gained 4% to a new all-time high. That puts the Chinese Internet portal 19% past a 38.84 buy point from a five-week pattern.

On the downside, former leader Huron Consulting Group (HURN) gapped down and plunged 67% on news of an accounting scandal. The company will restate more than three years of financial statements and announced the resignation of its CEO and chief financial officer.
O'Reilly Automotive (ORLY) gapped down and fell 3% after a downgrade. FBR Capital cut shares to underperform from market perform.
Group mate AutoZone (AZO) gapped down and slipped 2%.
12:15 p.m. Update: Market Pares Gains At Midday
BY JONAH KERI
Stocks trimmed their morning gains at midday Monday, though the major indexes remained higher.
The S&P 500 was up 0.9%, the Dow 0.8%, the Nasdaq 0.6% and the NYSE composite 1.6%.
Volume remained higher across the board.

5:15 p.m. Update: The Nasdaq composite led the major indexes in a decisive move higher, joining the other major indexes in a rally attempt.
Tuesday was Day 1 in an attempted rally for the Nasdaq but Day 3 for the S&P 500, Dow and NYSE composite.
A follow-through day cannot occur before Day 4.
Volume was up sharply on both exchanges.
Nearly 9% of the 197 industry groups tracked by IBD posted double-digit advances. Metal products distributors, diversified operations and money center banks led the pack.
Citigroup (C) saw the Dow's biggest price percentage gain. Wynn Resorts (WYNN) led the Nasdaq 100 throughout the day. Morgan Stanley (MS) was the top price gainer among S&P 500 stocks above $10.
After hours, J. Crew Group (JCG) jumped 8% on news of its loss of 22 cents per share in Q4, vs. estimates for a 25-cent loss. Revenue slipped to $388 million but topped views for $374.8 million.

DXP Enterprises (DXPE) stabbed 21% higher, adding to its 8% gain in regular trading. The supplier of pumps and sundry maintenance items to offshore oil and gas producers reported Q4 EPS of 51 cents, topping analyst views by 2 cents.
Wednesday presents a light economic calendar, with weekly data on crude oil inventories due out after 10:30 a.m.
Staples (SPLS) is scheduled to report earnings before the market opens. Diamond Foods (DMND) and TBS International (TBSI) are slated to report after the close.
4:15 p.m. Update: Indexes Notch Best Day Of 2009
BY JUAN CARLOS ARANCIBIA
The market surged into the close, finishing with the best gains of the year so far.
The Nasdaq soared 7.1%, the NYSE composite 6.5%, the S&P 500 6.4% and the Dow 5.8%.
Volume swelled.
Financials led after Citigroup (C) told employees the bank was profitable in the first two months of 2009.

The rally got another shot in the arm when Rep. Barney Frank said there are plans to reinstate the uptick rule on short selling. Meanwhile, Fed Chairman Ben Bernanke seemed open to modifying mark-to-market accounting rules.
Metals also led, but gold stocks slid as the precious metal fell below $900 an ounce. The stock rally softened safe-haven plays.
3:15 p.m. Update: Indexes Carry Solid Gains Into Final Hour
BY ALAN R. ELLIOTT
Financials continued posting the day's strongest performance as indexes eased slightly, but held the bulk of the day's broad surge.
The Nasdaq composite rode a 5.4% advance. The NYSE composite owned a 5% gain. The S&P 500 and the Dow racked up 4.7% and 4% moves.

SL Green Realty (SLG), Thor Industries (THOR) and Dick's Sporting Goods (DKS) were among the S&P 500's top gainers. Citigroup (C), Bank of America (BAC) and General Electric (GE) led the Dow. Wynn Resorts  (WYNN), First Solar (FSLR) and Millicom International (MICC) topped the gains by Nasdaq 100 above 10.
Volume continued higher on both exchanges, up 28% on the NYSE and 15% higher on the Nasdaq.
Advancing stocks led decliners by about 5-to-1 on the Nasdaq and by a 7-to-1 margin on the NYSE.

Allegiant Travel (ALGT) rocked 10% higher, adding a second day of sharp gains and driving shares above their 50-day moving average. The Las Vegas-based, low-fare air carrier is building the right side to a possible base begun in January.
S&P 400 component FMC Technologies (FTI) stirred up an 8% gain in strong trading. But the maker of valves and fittings for oil and natural gas applications remains deep in a nine-month correction.

On the downside, Randgold Resources (GOLD) dumped 8% in heavy action as gold prices continued their two-day slide. The gold miner may be forming a new base, after a February breakout above a deep cup-with-handle base.
2:15 p.m. Update: Gains Hold Into Afternoon Trading

With the subsea recovery slowly gaining momentum, TechnipFMC plc (FTI  -  Free Report) was recently awarded a slew of three fresh contracts offshore Malaysia, the Gulf of Mexico (GoM) and Israel. The company has secured engineering, procurement, construction and installation contracts on three separate projects.The first integrated EPCI (iEPCI) contract clinched by TechnipFMC is from Energean Oil & Gas for the Karish field development project, located offshore Israel. Per the contract, the London-based oilfield services provider will design, procure, construct and install the subsea system, a floating production storage and offloading unit along with a pipeline system and valve station at the receiving junction.The second EPCI contract has been awarded by Sabah Shell Petroleum Company Ltd. for the Gumusut-Kakap phase 2 project, located offshore Malaysia. According to the deal, TechnipFMC will execute the delivery and installation of subsea equipment including umbilicals, flowlines and the subsea production system.The third contract is awarded by LLOG Exploration for the development of Who Dat field in Mexico. The iEPCI contract entails the delivery and installation of multiphase pumping system by TechnipFMC.  With the massive recovery of crude prices from the historic lows, the commodity has been comfortably trading above $60 a barrel since the past couple of months. As a result, many energy companies are slowly increasing their spending on upstream projects, translating into more contracts for oilfield service providers like TechnipFMC.The subsea orders of the company have gradually started building up. The same for the 2017 stood at $5.1 billion, reflecting an increase of 27% compared with the tally in 2016. In fact, last quarter, the company’s subsea segment secured new orders of worth $1.72 billion inclusive of the Fenja development agreement in the Norwegian North Sea.TechnipFMC carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold). A few better-ranked players in the same industry are Flotek Industries, Inc. (FTK  -  Free Report), Solaris Oilfield Infrastructure, Inc. (SOI  -  Free Report) and Archrock, Inc. (AROC  -  Free Report). While Flotek and Solaris Oilfield sport a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy), Archrock holds a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy). You can see the complete list of today’s Zacks #1 Rank stocks here.TechnipFMC plc Price TechnipFMC plc Price | TechnipFMC plc Quote Flotek’s earnings are likely to witness year-over-year growth of 557.14% in 2018.Solaris Oilfield earnings are likely to witness a year-over-year rise of 258.33% in 2018.Archrock’s bottom line is likely to witness a year-over-year surge of 195% in 2018.Today's Stocks from Zacks' Hottest StrategiesIt's hard to believe, even for us at Zacks. But while the market gained +21.9% in 2017, our top stock-picking screens have returned +115.0%, +109.3%, +104.9%, +98.6%, and +67.1%.And this outperformance has not just been a recent phenomenon. Over the years it has been remarkably consistent. From 2000 - 2017, the composite yearly average gain for these strategies has beaten the market more than 19X over. TechnipFMC plc (FTI  -  Free Report) recently agreed to the terms for jointly developing a new generation of hybrid flexible pipe (HFP) with Magma Global Ltd. This type of pipe will be used in offshore activities.Per the deal, the oilfield service provider TechnipFMC will acquire a minority interest in Magma Global that produces high strength carbon fiber pipes.Project Importance The company expects the HFP to heighten performance and stress-bearing ability of subsea fluid transportations. It is also assumed to reduce cost and weight of the carriers, which in turn will increase efficiency. The HFP will be made keeping in mind the demand for composite subsea infrastructure that connects the seabed to the surface.This is nothing new for TechnipFMC, a regular investor in technologies. The company has shown its technology leadership through Subsea 2.0. It is currently advancing on developing next-generation floating liquefied natural gas (FLNG).TechnipFMC expects the deal to improve its Subsea 2.0 product platform. The cost-effective HFP solution will enable the company address offshore deepwater difficulties around the globe and help its clients. Moreover, the strategic collaboration with Magma Global is expected to put both the companies in leadership positions in their respective markets.About TechnipFMCLondon-based TechnipFMC is a leading manufacturer and supplier of technology solutions for the energy industry. The company, which reached its current form following the January 2017 merger between Technip and FMC Technologies, is engaged in the designing, producing and servicing of technologically sophisticated systems, and products for subsea, onshore/offshore, and surface projects. The company currently has more than 37,000 employees.Price PerformanceTechnipFMC has lost 8.3% in a year compared with 22.8% decline of its industry. Zacks Rank and Stocks to ConsiderTechnipFMC has a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold).A few better-ranked stocks in the oil and energy sector are Pioneer Natural Resources Company (PXD  -  Free Report), Continental Resources, Inc. (CLR  -  Free Report) and W&T Offshore, Inc. (WTI  -  Free Report). While Pioneer Natural and Continental Resources sport a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy), W&T Offshore carries a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy). You can see the complete list of today’s Zacks #1 Rank stocks here.Irving, TX-based Pioneer Natural is an independent oil and gas exploration and production company. Its revenues for first-quarter 2018 are anticipated to improve 23.7% from the prior-year quarter. The company delivered an average beat of 66.9% in the trailing four quarters.Oklahoma City, OK-based Continental Resources is an oil and gas exploration and production company. Its revenues for first-quarter 2018 are expected to improve 54.9% from the year-ago quarter. For 2018, the bottom line is anticipated to be up 364.7%.Houston, TX-based W&T Offshore is an upstream energy player. Its earnings for 2018 are anticipated to improve 3.6% year over year. The company pulled off an average positive earnings surprise of 542.8% in the trailing four quarters.Looking for Stocks with Skyrocketing Upside?Zacks has just released a Special Report on the booming investment opportunities of legal marijuana.Ignited by new referendums and legislation, this industry is expected to blast from an already robust $6.7 billion to $20.2 billion in 2021. TechnipFMC plc (FTI  -  Free Report) recently received a front-end engineering design (FEED) contract for the floating production storage and offloading (FPSO) unit of BP p.l.c. (BP  -  Free Report), located in the Tortue/Ahmeyim offshore field near Mauritania and Senegal.The field is located between the Saint-Louis Profond block off the coast of Senegal and C-8 block offshore Mauritania. Notably, this new contract marks the sixth deal for TechnipFMC this year, as the resurgence of deepwater and subsea projects, following the oil price recovery have worked favorably for the company.Deal DetailsTechnipFMC will be responsible for the technology and equipment scope of the liquefied natural gas (LNG) project. The collaboration – which can be converted into an Engineering, Procurement, Construction and Installation (EPCI) deal in the future – is also likely to open the full potential of the development in West Africa.The Tortue discovery is credited to Kosmos Energy Ltd. (KOS  -  Free Report), which divested a chunk of its interests to BP during the year-end 2016, making BP the operator of the field with around 60% stake. The British energy giant along with its partners is expected to make the final investment plan in the project by the end of 2018.About TechnipFMCLondon-based TechnipFMC is a leading manufacturer and supplier of technology solutions for the energy industry. TechnipFMC plc (FTI  -  Free Report) and Honeywell UOP, a subsidiary of Honeywell International Inc. (HON  -  Free Report), recently signed memorandums of understanding (MOUs) with Motiva Enterprises, an American unit of Saudi Aramco. The deals, which are expected to enable the Saudi Arabian state-run oil company to unite its petrochemicals business with oil refining, are valued at $8-$10 billion.The move is expected to help Motiva examine petrochemical production technology, which can be used in a chemical plant to be built at its Port Arthur, TX site. The deal marks the latest trend of oil companies to focus on petrochemical business in order to diversify their portfolio. Additionally, Motiva was planning to ramp up its Port Arthur refinery’s capacity from 603,000 barrel per day (BPD) to 1-1.5 million BPD.London-based TechnipFMC will provide Motiva with its technology of mixed-feed ethylene production in the United States. The technology leader, TechnipFMC's knowledge is expected to help Motiva produce two million tons of ethylene per annum, which is a crucial component of making plastics. TechnipFMC was roped into the deal, which is in line with Saudi Aramco's plan of investing $18 billion in its subsidiary Motiva, in order to expand the Port Arthur facility and sway into petrochemical production.Meanwhile, Honeywell UOP's aromatics unit will provide Motiva with the technology of converting by-products of the production of gasoline, benzene and paraxylene into two million tons of feedstock per year, for plastics and chemicals.The final investment plan for the project — expected sometime next year — is subject to regulatory and competitive conditions.Zacks Rank and Stocks to ConsiderOil-field service provider, TechnipFMC, and diversified technology and manufacturing companyHoneywell, both carry a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold).Some better-ranked stocks in the oil and energy sector are CNOOC Limited (CEO  -  Free Report) and Continental Resources, Inc. (CLR  -  Free Report), each sporting a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy). You can see the complete list of today’s Zacks #1 Rank stocks here.Hong Kong-based CNOOC is an integrated energy company. Its revenues for 2018 are anticipated to improve 51.3% year over year, while its bottom line is expected to increase 80.8%.Oklahoma City, OK-based Continental Resources is an oil and gas exploration and production company. Its revenues for first-quarter 2018 are estimated to soar 55.7% from the year-ago quarter’s figure. A month has gone by since the last earnings report for TechnipFMC plc (FTI  -  Free Report). Shares have added about 4.9% in that time frame.Will the recent positive trend continue leading up to its next earnings release, or is FTI due for a pullback? Before we dive into how investors and analysts have reacted as of late, let's take a quick look at its most recent earnings report in order to get a better handle on the important drivers.Fourth-Quarter 2017 ResultsTechnipFMC plc reported fourth-quarter 2017 earnings on a diluted basis (excluding one-time items) of 20 cents a share, missing the Zacks Consensus Estimate of 44 cents. The weak results can be attributed to lower revenues amid reduced project activities from its subsea segment. The bottom line also deteriorated from the year-ago adjusted earnings of 50 cents a share.Revenues in the fourth quarter came in at $3,683 million below the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $3,834 million. Further, the revenues in the quarter under review also decreased 15.9% from the prior-year figure of $4,379.7 million.Segmental AnalysisSubsea: The segment’s revenues for the fourth quarter were $1,292.2 million, reflecting a decrease of 36.2% from the year-ago figure of $2,024.1 million. Reduced project activities in Europe, Africa and Asia pacific regions led to the lower revenues. Concurrently, operating profit came in at $67.4 million, down 53.9% year over year.Onshore/Offshore: This segment generated revenues of $2,019.5 million, down 2% year over year. Revenues declined due to completion of the first phase of a key LNG project, partly offset by increased activities in the Middle East, Europe and Asia Pacific regions. However, operating income jumped to $257.2 million versus operating loss of $55 million recorded in the fourth quarter of 2016.  Strong project execution, especially successful progression of Yamal LNG project drove the profit of the segment.Surface Technologies: The segment’s revenues for the fourth quarter were $372.3 million, up 22.6% from fourth-quarter 2016 figure of $303.6 million. The increase is primarily attributed to the rising momentum in the North American as well as completion activity. Further, a favorable product mix and leaner cost structure helped the company to report an operating profit of $53.3 million against an operating loss of $5.3 million incurred a year ago.BacklogAs of Dec 31, 2017, TechnipFMC’s total backlog was $12,982.8 million compared with $16,743.9 million a year ago. Of this, backlog for Onshore/Offshore was $6,369.1 million, while Subsea and Surface Technologies backlogs were $6,203.9 million and $409.8 million, respectively.Capex & Balance SheetIn the reported quarter, TechnipFMC spent $85.3 million on capital programs. As of Dec 31, the company had cash and cash equivalents of $6,737.4 million and long-term debt of $3,777.9 million, with a debt-to-capitalization ratio of 22%.DividendThe board of directors declared a quarterly cash dividend of 13 cents per share, payable on Apr 4, 2018 to shareholders of record as of Mar 20, 2018.GuidanceTechnipFMC projects revenues for Onshore/ Offshore segment to be within the range of $5.3-$5.7 billion in 2018, with an EBITDA margin of 10.5%, up from the prior guidance of 9.5%. Surface Technologies are expected to generate revenues between $1.5-1.6 billion, with EBITDA margin of 17.5%. The company estimates its subsea revenues to lie within $5-$5.3 billion, with EBITDA margin of 14%.  Capex for 2018 is estimated to be around $300 million.How Have Estimates Been Moving Since Then?In the past month, investors have witnessed an upward trend in fresh estimates. There have been four revisions higher for the current quarter compared to two lower.TechnipFMC plc Price and Consensus  TechnipFMC plc Price and Consensus | TechnipFMC plc QuoteVGM ScoresAt this time, FTI has a poor Growth Score of F. Its Momentum is doing a lot better with a C. The stock was also allocated a grade of C on the value side, putting it in the middle 20% for this investment strategy.Overall, the stock has an aggregate VGM Score of D. If you aren't focused on one strategy, this score is the one you should be interested in.Zacks' style scores indicate that the company's stock is suitable for value and momentum investors.OutlookEstimates have been broadly trending upward for the stock and the magnitude of these revisions looks promising. Notably, FTI has a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold). We expect an in-line return from the stock in the next few months.

Schlumberger Limited (SLB  -  Free Report) recently announced that the company is considering an opportunity to form a joint venture (JV) with Subsea 7 S.A. (SUBCY  -  Free Report) to provide clients with better subsea installations and oilfield services, derived from their Subsea Integration Alliance's success. Following the news of JV formation, Schlumberger gained 2.4% and Subsea stocks added 7.1% on last Friday.The JV is expected to improve client efficiency and provide cost synergies to the partners, which will in turn, result in increasing total production. It will enable the companies to offer their clients more integrated deepwater services. Per the deal, both the companies in the 50-50 partnership can provide non-integrated products and services individually to their clients.Such JV’s are common in the industry where it operates. At the beginning of last year, TechnipFMC plc (FTI  -  Free Report) came into existence following the merger between Technip and FMC Technologies. It is engaged in the designing, producing and servicing of technologically sophisticated systems and products for subsea, onshore/offshore, and surface projects. Forming the JV is expected to enable the partnership obtain higher market share.Price Performance Schlumberger has lost 17.9% in the last year compared with 26.7% decline of its industry.About the CompaniesHouston, TX-based Schlumberger is a leading oilfield services company, providing technology, project management and information services to the global oil and gas industry. Schlumberger’s reporting segments can be categorized into four segments: Reservoir Characterization, Drilling, Production and Cameron. The company is currently operating in more than 85 countries.On the other hand, based in London, UK, Subsea is a provider of several technical solutions to the offshore energy industry.Zacks Rank and Stocks to ConsiderSchlumberger carries a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold).A better-ranked stock in the oil and energy sector is Pioneer Natural Resources Company (PXD  -  Free Report), which sports a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy). You can see the complete list of today’s Zacks #1 Rank stocks here.Irving, TX-based Pioneer Natural Resources is an independent oil and gas exploration and production company. Its revenues for first-quarter 2018 are expected to improve 22.8% from the year-ago quarter. For 2018, the bottom line is anticipated to be up 166.2%.Will You Make a Fortune on the Shift to Electric Cars?Here's another stock idea to consider. Much like petroleum 150 years ago, lithium power may soon shake the world, creating millionaires and reshaping geo-politics. Soon electric vehicles (EVs) may be cheaper than gas guzzlers. Some are already reaching 265 miles on a single charge.With battery prices plummeting and charging stations set to multiply, one company stands out as the #1 stock to buy according to Zacks research.It's not the one you think.See This Ticker Free >>

TechnipFMC plc (FTI  -  Free Report) is set to release fourth-quarter 2017 results on Feb 21, after the closing bell.A leading manufacturer and supplier of technology solutions for the energy industry, TechnipFMC offers subsea, surface, onshore and offshore solutions for oil and gas projects.In the prior quarter, this London-based company reported weaker-than-expected earnings amid reduced project activities in Europe and Africa.Let’s see how things are shaping up for this announcement.TechnipFMC Price and EPS Surprise TechnipFMC, Inc. Price and EPS Surprise | TechnipFMC, Inc. QuoteFactors to ConsiderThough oil prices have recovered from the historical lows, prices still linger around $60 per barrel, which is far below the breakeven price for many oil and gas firms even now. As a result, many energy companies continue to reduce spending and equipment suppliers like TechnipFMC struggle to protect its backlog amid the volatile price environment. For the fourth quarter, the Zacks Consensus Estimate for the total backlog order is pegged at $12,854 million against $13,902.4 million reported in the prior quarter. The backlog for subsea technologies is anticipated at $5,680 million against $5,949 million reported in third-quarter 2017. The Surface Technology backlog is also expected to decline to $352 million against 394.2 million reported in the previous quarter.Further, analysts polled by Zacks expect revenues of $3,834 million for the quarter, down from the prior-year quarter figure of $4,141 million. The Zacks Consensus Estimate for the revenues of the Onshore/Offshore segment is pegged at $1,867 million, lower than $2,308 million recorded in the prior quarter. Moreover, TechnipFMC’s subsea segment, which was once the largest and fastest-growing unit of FTI, is also facing pressure on its revenues and margins. In the last quarter, Subsea revenues and profits declined 37% and 71.3% year over year.The company has already cautioned that 2017 would be a difficult year with order growth set to remain weak. All these factors account for bleak earnings outlook for the company in fourth-quarter 2017.Earnings WhispersOur proven model does not conclusively show that TechnipFMC is likely to beat earnings estimates this quarter. This is because a stock needs to have both a positive Earnings ESP and a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy), 2 (Buy) or 3 (Hold) for this to happen.That is not the case here as you will see below.Zacks ESP: Earnings ESP for the company is -5.02%. This is because the Zacks Consensus Estimate is pegged at 44 cents while the Most Accurate Estimate stands at 42 cents. You can uncover the best stocks to buy or sell before they’re reported with our Earnings ESP Filter.Zacks Rank: TechnipFMC carries a Zacks Rank #4 (Sell). Please note that we caution against stocks with a Zacks Rank #4 or 5 (Strong Sell) going into the earnings announcement, especially when the company is witnessing negative estimate revisions.Stocks to ConsiderWhile an earnings beat looks uncertain for TechnipFMC, here are some companies you may want to consider as our model shows that these also have the right combination of elements to post an earnings beat:Houston, TX-based EOG Resources (EOG  -  Free Report) is an upstream company. It has an Earnings ESP of +4.06% and a Zacks Rank of 1. The company is scheduled to release fourth-quarter earnings on Feb 27. It has an Earnings ESP of + 5.26% and a Zacks Rank #1. The company is slated to release fourth-quarter earnings on Mar 7.Dallas, TX-based RSP Permian, Inc. (RSPP  -  Free Report) is an upstream energy company with an Earnings ESP of +1.64%. It is a Zacks #1 Ranked player. It is expected to unveil fourth quarter earnings on Feb 27.Wall Street’s Next AmazonZacks EVP Kevin Matras believes this familiar stock has only just begun its climb to become one of the greatest investments of all time.
